name: B. Points on Plane
statement:
You are given a two-dimensional plane, and you need to place n chips on
it. You can place a chip only at a point with integer coordinates. The
cost of placing a chip at the point (x, y) is equal to |x| + |y| (where
|a| is the absolute value of a).The cost of placing n chips is equal to
the among the costs of each chip.You need to place n chips on the plane
in such a way that the Euclidean distance between each pair of chips is
than 1, and the cost is the minimum possible.
